meanings.definition: A bitter white crystalline purine alkaloid that is a stimulant of the central nervous system.
meanings.sent1: After drinking a cup of coffee, I could feel the caffeine waking me up.
meanings.sent2: Many people rely on caffeine to help them stay alert during the day.
meanings.sent3: The caffeine in my tea whispered, 'Time to wake up!'
meanings.sent4: Her energy was like caffeine, sparking life into every room she entered.
meanings.sent5: The caffeine buzzed through my veins, making me feel alive and awake.

meanings.definition: A compound found especially in tea and coffee plants and used medicinally as a stimulant and diuretic.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy the taste of caffeine in my morning cup of tea.
meanings.sent2: Doctors sometimes recommend caffeine to help with certain medical conditions.
meanings.sent3: The caffeine in the coffee winked at me, promising a boost of energy.
meanings.sent4: His words were like caffeine, invigorating and stimulating our minds.
meanings.sent5: As I sipped the coffee, the caffeine worked its magic, making me feel more awake.
